meanings.definition: The state of being outdated or no longer current.
meanings.sent1: The outdatedness of the technology made it difficult to use.
meanings.sent2: Her wardrobe showed signs of outdatedness with its retro style.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously highlighted the outdatedness of the fashion trends.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house exuded an eerie outdatedness, as if frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used examples to illustrate the concept of outdatedness in a fun way.

meanings.definition: The quality of being out of date or old-fashioned.
meanings.sent1: We could see the outdatedness of the car model by its design.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant's decor had an air of outdatedness that some found charming.
meanings.sent3: The sitcom poked fun at the outdatedness of the main character's slang.
meanings.sent4: The mansion's grandeur had an outdatedness that whispered of past glory.
meanings.sent5: The advertisement cleverly played on the outdatedness of traditional marketing tactics.
